Package controller

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Player
    this interface defines a prototype for any 'Player', as we all know, players play games, and so do ours.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CPUPlayer
    This class together with other concrete subclasses of 'Player', and the context class make up the "controller" of the tic tac toe game.

    This class, when instantiated, represents the AI player.
    HumanPlayer
    This class together with other concrete subclasses of 'Player', and the context class make up the "controller" of the tic tac toe game.

    this class when instantiated is an object that represents the human player, it implements two interfaces, 'Player' and 'ActionListener' this is so that the human player can be both a player, allowing human player and the CPU player to be used polymorphically, AND it is the ActionListener that controls what happens when the buttons on the board are clicked.

    This class provides public methods as defined in the 'Player' and 'ActionListener' Interfaces.
    PlayerContext
    This class together with other concrete subclasses of 'Player' make up the "controller" of the tic tac toe game.

    This is the context class in a "state pattern" arrangement based on the GOF design patterns book.
